name: Kepler-127
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-127 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-127 is a star with 1.774999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.36 times its radius. It is located 1162.45 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-127 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-127 b

Kepler-127 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 14.44 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-127.

The mass of Kepler-127 b is 2.16 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-127 b is 1.4 that of Earth. At 2.16 Earth masses, Kepler-127 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-127 c

Kepler-127 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 29.39 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-127.

The mass of Kepler-127 c is 10.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-127 c is 2.66 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-127 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-127 d

Kepler-127 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.28 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 48.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-127.

The mass of Kepler-127 d is 9.93 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-127 d is 2.64 that of Earth. At 9.93 Earth masses, Kepler-127 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-127, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
